reviews.text: Just returned from three nights at this lovely hotel. Classic room was charming, nicely decorated, comfortable and very clean. Breakfast cost 12 euros and worth it. Excellent location near Luxembourg and Blvd. St. Germain on a quiet street great for sleeping - unlike many hotels in Paris where bar traffic goes until the wee hours of the morning. Walked to everything. Highly recommended and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Jardin de L'Odeon in Paris for one week for an anniversary celebration. Starting with our original phone call to the reception staff, the staff were uniformly courteous and helpful. The rooms were charmingly decorated and furnished and spotlessly maintained. The location near the Luxembourg Gardens and the Odeon Theater is very appealing. Quiet street...no noise. Pleasant courtyard.
reviews.title: A very special hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night (Fri. 23rd May) but thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was quite spacious for Paris and cost €160 per night. The décor was fresh and comfortable. The room had air-conditioning. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate – apart from the fact that the shower holder was broken. A good range of quality toiletries was provided. We had a fab side-ways view of the Theatre de l’Odeon. The street was very quiet, but just minutes from a vibrant area with many lovely restaurants and cafes. The metro (Odeon) was 5mins away. We had breakfast, at €12 per person, with a good selection of bread, pastries, cold meats & cheeses, fruit and yogurt. The breakfast room staff, in particular, were very, very pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel and will return to it next time we visit Paris.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great location

likes.liked: — Location on quiet street but close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week at the Jardin de l'Odeon. Great location and very comfortable hotel. Small room and tiny bathroom but lucked out with a nice terrace (room #38). Worked perfectly for our 20th anniversary and first visit to Paris. Clean, quiet, smoke free, and good service. Tasty breakfast that was included in our room when we booked through Travelocity (175 euros/night). We wandered and ate throughout the city but our best meal was at a seafood restaurant around the corner Le Mediterrane'. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Je t'aime Jardin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from paris, the stuff at the hotel side was helpful, they are quite handsome too =) i forgot the guy that recommended me some restaurant, just want to say a big thank you. You were very helpful.
reviews.title: breakfast charges should be spell out clearly

likes.liked: — the hotel stuff is very friendly and helpful and the location is good (quite central to the places of interest)
likes.disliked: — they did not provide breakfast or at least it should be spell out clearly we had to pay for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very freindly and helpful. The room was very nicely furnished, bright and clean. The room is very good for the nightly rate and especially since the location is so very convenient. The hotel is on a quite side street very close to the Odeon theater and yet close to the hopping areas in the Latin Quarter. I personally prefer to spend time in this part of Paris for the upbeat environment anyway and to have a great quiet hotel room in this location is perfect. I found that all the staff all speak very good English. That doesn't mean you should not at least politely say your "bonjour"s and "merci"s.
reviews.title: Great location, Great service, Great Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for six nights at the Jardin de L’Odeon Hotel.
reviews.title: Jardin le L'Odeon: Well Located, Very Nice Hotel.

reviews.text: Great location, on a quiet street near to shop’s and restaurants.
reviews.title: Clean, Small and Well Located

reviews.text: The room (01) is lovely and beautiful decorated, little patio with 2 chears and table.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at Jardin de L'Odeon

reviews.text: In the morning you can hear the birds singing.
reviews.title: Great location, very nice hotel

likes.disliked: — it was a very small room - but comfortable

reviews.text: We (2 adultes & 2 kids) stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. The Staff at the reception were very kind. Rooms (1 superior, 1 standard) are small but clean and modern. Breakfast (12€) expensive for children but ok for adultes. To be reached by Metro very easily, even with luggage. Exterior and interior of this hotel are modern, well maintained and decorated with great taste. Next to the metro station (3 minutes by feet) are a few nice small roads with little restaurants where in the evening not only tourists go out but also students and locals. However the area around the hotel is very quiet as it is mainly a residential area. For our next trip we will stay again at this hotel and I will not try to search for a better one.
reviews.title: Calm hotel in a busy town

reviews.text: My 6 night stay at the Jardin de L'Odeon was really outstanding! The room was beautiful, comfortable and well appointed and the service by all of the staff was exemplary. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Latin Quarter (the location is fantastic and if you are a tourist, this is by far the best if you want to see the main Paris attractions).
reviews.title: Jardin de L'Odeon was outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location.
reviews.title: Jardin L'Odeon - a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel, friendly, helpful staff.
reviews.title: Excellent service staff, but one problem

likes.liked: — Excellent service level of hotel staff
likes.disliked: — Coolness of air-conditioning cannot be controlled from the room during my stay in early May

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are small, but nice (no smaller than anything you would find in a boutique hotel in downtown Manhattan).
reviews.title: Great weekend at the Jardin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a Ruby Wedding Anniversary and it was a really pleasant and friendly hotel in a quiet location. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated, not oversized but adequote for a short stay. Breakfast was good value for money with a reasonable selection served by an excellent member of staff.
reviews.title: 'As we expected - Very Pleasant Hotel & Area'

likes.disliked: — No Tea & Coffee facilities in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay was marred by theft of wallet en route to hotel but the staff were a great help and even provided an advance of Euros to keep us going.
reviews.title: Perfect!!
Great Location!
reviews.text: Would definately recommend a stay here but keep all your belongings very secure when in and around train / metro stations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just to repeat what other people say...fantastic location, we love this area of Paris. Great staff, clean room and decent breakfast. But.......if you want a U.S. size room....stay home!
reviews.title: Jardin de L'Odeon - well recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were EXTREMELY helpful and friendly. It is an ideal quiet location and we will definately be staying here again.
reviews.title: Perfect!!
